citation.article-title: Phylogenetic relationships among marine Alteromonas-like proteobacteria: emended description of the family Alteromonadaceae and proposal of Pseudoalteromonadaceae fam. nov., Colwelliaceae fam. nov., Shewanellaceae fam. nov., Moritellaceae fam. nov., Ferrimonadaceae fam. nov., Idiomarinaceae fam. nov. and Psychromonadaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Ferrimonadaceae (Fer.ri.mo.na.da′ce.ae. N.L. fem. n. Ferrimonas type genus of the family; -aceae ending to denote a family; N.L. fem. pl. n. Ferrimonadaceae the Ferrimonas family).
Do not form endospores or microcysts.
The major fatty acids are i15 : 0, 16 : 1ω9 and 17 : 1ω9.
The family is a member of the ‘Gammaproteobacteria’.
The type genus is Ferrimonas Rosselló-Mora et al. 1995.
